alert.note: Alert for Grant Grove Area; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kings Canyon NP; Sequoia NP; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 3:43AM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ABOVE 6,000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 6,000 feet. Total snow accumulations of two to three feet conceivable above 8,000 feet. Total snow amounts of one to two feet possible from 7,000 feet to 8,000 feet. Total snow accumulations of three to six inches conceivable from 6,000 feet to 7,000 feet. Winds may gust as high as 55 mph on exposed ridgetops and along the crest. * WHERE...Sierra Nevada from Yosemite National Park to Sequoia National Park. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely difficult or nearly impossible. Plan on road closures due to snow cover. Strong wind gusts could cause extensive tree damage. Snow load may cause roof damage.
info.instruction: If you plan to travel, consider alternate strategies. If you must travel, remember to carry tire chains, plenty of food, a good deal of water, warm clothing, and a flashlight in your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
